segments.text: I see the water from the sink just pouring onto the floor, creating a huge, messy puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in it, but she doesn't even seem to notice or care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like that, and why no one has done anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, taking cookies from the jar behind her back, and it's frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy on the stool is going to fall and hurt himself if he's not careful, and it's going to be a big mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share of the cookies, not even noticing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed any of this yet, it's surprising.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful and nice compared to the chaos inside, which is a stark contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really tell her about the water and the kids before it's too late and everything is ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just a disaster waiting to happen, and it's making me anxious to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
